General Meeting #2
Thurs, Oct. 12, 2023; 7-9pm
Broida 1610

Analyzing the Relationship Between Family Themes and Movie Ratings






Analyzing the Relationship Between Family Themes and Movie Ratings

Do Daddy Issues Sell? This project sought to explore the relationship between movie ratings in genres pertaining to family themes and those not pertaining to family themes.
Group Members: Anna Xue, Kris Hao, Mollie Jiang, and Nixon Carino

 











Best Bang for your Buck






Best Bang for your Buck

This project sought to determine which fast food chains provide the “best bang for your buck”. More concretely, the nutritional content of meals from various fast food chains was analyzed, and restaurants were awarded one of “best health”, “best deals” and “best overall”.
Group Members: Brendan McGuinness, Alaina Liu

 











Real or Fake Faces






Real or Fake Faces

With the rise of AI-generated media, the ability to recognize real from fake is imperative. The goal of this project was to train a series of simple models to recognize photos of real faces from photos of artificially-generated faces.
Group Members: Yishan, Alice, Johanna P.

 











TV Show and Movie Popularity Analysis






TV Show and Movie Popularity Analysis

Description goes here.
Group Members: Christian Garduno, Roshan Mehta, Colton Rowe

title: About
text:
Founded in 2023 by Kris Hao and Anya Macomber, the workshop series aims to provide an inclusive and collegial atmosphere where motivated students can engage more fully with real-world datasets and projects. Our goals as an organization are:

To make statistics accessible to all skill levels
To build a community around data science at UCSB
Ensure the success of our members by guiding them through their own resume-building data science projects
